FuncDef:
The pcp prefer-failure enhance enable command enables the prefer_failure enhancement in PCP.
The undo pcp prefer-failure enhance enable command disables the prefer_failure enhancement in PCP.
By default, the PCP refer_failure enhancement is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a P2P download scenario, BT software can communicate with BT software using the PCP protocol. Terminal software of the private network users sends PCP MAP request packets carrying the prefer_failure option and non-0 public network IP addresses. Upon receipt of the packets, the PCP server can randomly assign public network IP using the PCP prefer_failure enhancement.
By default, without the PCP prefer_failure enhancement enabled, for PCP MAP request packets carry the prefer_failure option and non-0 public network IP addresses, if the PCP server assigns public network IP addresses different from those for which the users apply, a failure message is returned.
Prerequisites
A PCP server has been configured using the pcp server command in the NAT instance view or pcp server command in the DS-Lite instance view.
Precautions
If a PCP client forcibly specifies a public port number that a PCP server assigns, run the port-single enable command in the NAT444 or DS-Lite instance view to enable per-port allocation mode.
